facts.text: Atlanta United FC was founded in 2014 and began play in Major League Soccer in 2017.
Atlanta United FC won the MLS Cup in their second season, 2018.
Gerardo Martino was the first head coach of Atlanta United FC.
Atlanta United FC plays home games at Mercedes-Benz Stadium, which they share with the NFL's Atlanta Falcons.
Arthur Blank, owner of the Atlanta Falcons and co-founder of Home Depot, operates Atlanta United FC.
Atlanta United FC has set league records for highest single-match and average attendance.
Forbes estimated Atlanta United FC to be the fourth most valuable MLS club in 2024, worth approximately $900 million.
Atlanta was the largest metropolitan area without an MLS franchise at the time Atlanta United FC was announced.
The sale and relocation of the NHL's Atlanta Thrashers to Winnipeg in 2011 helped restart efforts to bring an MLS expansion team to Atlanta.
MLS Commissioner Don Garber cited Atlanta as an "intriguing" market for league expansion in May 2012.
On April 16, 2014, MLS awarded an expansion franchise to Atlanta, which began play in 2017.
Atlanta United FC played its first regular season MLS game on March 5, 2017.
Yamil Asad scored the first goal in Atlanta United FC's history during their inaugural MLS game.
Atlanta United FC registered its first MLS win on March 12, 2017, against Minnesota United FC.
Atlanta United FC's first home win was on March 18, 2017, against Chicago Fire.
Atlanta United FC broke records for attendance for a non-doubleheader MLS game and average single-season attendance for a U.S. soccer team in their inaugural season.
Atlanta United FC became the third MLS expansion team to clinch a playoff berth in their inaugural season.
Atlanta United FC set a then-MLS attendance record for a playoff game with 67,221 spectators against Columbus Crew.
Atlanta United FC won the MLS Cup in their second season on December 8, 2018, against Portland Timbers.
The victory in the MLS Cup 2018 marked Atlanta's first major sports championship since the Atlanta Braves won the 1995 World Series.
Atlanta United FC's win in the MLS Cup 2018 qualified them for the 2019 CONCACAF Champions League for the first time.
Josef Martínez was named the league MVP the same year Tata Martino was named Coach of the Year.
Tata Martino left Atlanta United to become the manager of the Mexico national team after winning the MLS Cup.
Frank de Boer replaced Tata Martino as the head coach of Atlanta United.
Atlanta United became the first club from the United States to defeat a Mexican side in the Campeones Cup match by beating Club América 3-2.
Under Frank de Boer, Atlanta United won both the U.S. Open Cup and Campeones Cup.
Atlanta United was eliminated in the conference finals by Toronto FC during Frank de Boer's tenure.
The 2020 season for Atlanta United was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic after two wins in two matches.
Frank de Boer and Atlanta United mutually agreed to end his relationship with the club following their elimination from the MLS is Back Tournament.
Gabriel Heinze signed a two-year contract to be the head coach of Atlanta United at the end of 2020.
Josef Martínez returned to play for Atlanta United in 2021 after missing the 2020 season due to a torn ACL.
Gabriel Heinze was fired by Atlanta United after a club-record eight-game winless streak in the 2021 MLS season.
Gonzalo Pineda was named the fourth permanent head coach in Atlanta United's history in August 2021.
Atlanta United clinched a spot in the 2021 MLS Cup Playoffs with a victory over FC Cincinnati.
Atlanta United finished 11th in the Eastern Conference in the 2022 season and did not qualify for the playoffs.
The 2020 and 2021 editions of the U.S. Open Cup were canceled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Atlanta United finished 6th in the Eastern Conference in the 2022 season.
Atlanta United was knocked out in Round One of the MLS Cup Playoffs by the Columbus Crew in the 2022 season.
Atlanta United was knocked out of the 2023 U.S. Open Cup in the Third Round by Memphis 901 FC.
Atlanta United was knocked out of the 2023 Leagues Cup in the group stage.
Giorgos Giakoumakis was Atlanta United's top scorer in all competitions in 2023 with 19 goals.
Gonzalo Pineda was fired by Atlanta United on June 3, 2024, after the team lost 5 consecutive home matches, a club record.
Rob Valentino became the interim head coach of Atlanta United after Gonzalo Pineda was fired in 2024.
Atlanta United sold Thiago Almada for a reported fee of $22 million, plus $3 million in add-ons, breaking the MLS transfer record.
Atlanta United qualified for the wild card round of the 2024 MLS Cup playoffs and finished ninth in the Eastern Conference.
Atlanta United defeated CF Montréal in the wild card round and Inter Miami in round one of the 2024 MLS Cup playoffs but was eliminated by Orlando City in the following round.
Emmanuel Latte Lath's signing by Atlanta United in 2025 for $22 million was the most expensive signing in MLS history at the time.
Atlanta United FC's team name, logo, and colors were officially unveiled on July 7, 2015.
The logo of Atlanta United FC features a circle with a bold "A" at the center and five black and red stripes representing unity, determination, community, excellence, and innovation.
Atlanta United FC's official colors are black, red (Victory Red), and gold.
The team is unofficially known as "The Five Stripes," correlating to the five stripes on the team's inaugural home kits.
In 2019, Atlanta United introduced a new primary kit nicknamed "Star and Stripes," featuring nine thinner stripes on the front and a gold star above the team crest.
In February 2021, Atlanta United announced their first all-black kit named the "BLVCK" kit for the 2021 season.
American Family Insurance became Atlanta United's primary jersey sponsor on July 12, 2016.
Piedmont Healthcare became the first team's sleeve sponsor and the main sponsor for the reserve team on February 4, 2020.
AT&T was announced as Atlanta United's new sleeve sponsor on March 23, 2021.
Atlanta United launched a reserve team, Atlanta United 2, to compete in the United Soccer League starting in the 2018 season.
In 2023, Atlanta United 2 was moved to MLS NEXT Pro.
Atlanta United's youth academy competes in MLS NEXT and began play in the 2016–2017 USSDA season.
Mercedes-Benz Stadium, shared with the NFL's Atlanta Falcons, has a soccer capacity of 42,500 people but can expand to hold 71,000 people for full capacity events.
The largest single-match crowd in MLS history up to that time attended the MLS Cup 2018 at Mercedes-Benz Stadium with standing room for at least 73,019 people.
The opening of Mercedes-Benz Stadium was delayed to June 2017, and Atlanta United's first match in the stadium took place on September 10, 2017, against FC Dallas.
In what year did Atlanta United FC open the Children's Healthcare of Atlanta Training Ground?
What was the original planned location for Atlanta United FC's training facilities before being relocated to Marietta?
Decatur
How many officially recognized supporter groups does Atlanta United have?
Which supporter group of Atlanta United FC was established first?
Terminus Legion
Atlanta United FC played its home matches at which stadium in the first half of the 2017 MLS season?
Georgia Tech's Bobby Dodd Stadium
What is the name of the Atlanta United FC supporters group that was established with a focus on LGBTQ+ support and became official in 2022?
All Stripes
How many outdoor training fields are included in the Children's Healthcare of Atlanta Training Ground?
What nickname is given to Atlanta United FC supporters as a whole, referencing the club's inaugural year?
The "17s"
As of December 2017, how many season ticket holders did Atlanta United FC have?
More than 36,000
Which Atlanta United FC supporter group's name is a take on Atlanta hip-hop group Goodie Mob?
Footie Mob
On September 16, 2017, Atlanta United broke the MLS single-match attendance record previously held by LA Galaxy by selling more than 69,256 tickets for their match against Orlando City SC.

The official attendance for the Atlanta United vs. Orlando City SC match on September 16, 2017, was 70,425, making Atlanta the first MLS team to surpass 70,000 in attendance for a non-doubleheader match.
On October 22, 2017, Atlanta United broke the MLS single-match attendance record again with an official attendance of 71,874 for their match against Toronto FC.
Atlanta United finished the 2017 season with an average attendance of 48,200 for MLS regular season games, higher than English clubs Everton and Chelsea.
On March 11, 2018, Atlanta United set a new league single-match attendance record by selling 72,035 tickets for their home opener against D.C. United.
On June 30, 2018, Atlanta United had an attendance of 71,932, more than any other soccer game in the world that day, including the 2018 FIFA World Cup matches.
Atlanta United set the league single-match attendance record again on July 15, 2018, with 72,243 in attendance.
In 2018, Atlanta United became the first MLS team to average more than 50,000 in attendance for the regular season, with an average attendance of 53,002.
Atlanta United won its first MLS Cup on December 8, 2018, before a crowd of 73,019, the largest non-doubleheader crowd in league history.
On August 3, 2019, Atlanta United set another single-match attendance record with 72,548 in attendance for their match against the LA Galaxy.
Atlanta United introduced the Golden Spike tradition in their inaugural season, where players and supporters sign a large golden railroad spike before it is hammered into a platform by a local VIP.
Local celebrities such as 2 Chainz, Yung Joc, Waka Flocka, Zac Brown, Andruw Jones, Tiffany Hayes, Dennis Schröder, and Archie Eversole participated in the Golden Spike tradition during 2017.
In 2018, celebrities including T-Pain, Edgar Davids, Brian Jordan, Evander Holyfield and his son Elijah, Jeezy, Killer Mike, and Big Boi took part in the Golden Spike tradition.
At MLS Cup 2018, Atlanta United owner Arthur Blank hammered the Golden Spike.
Celebrities such as Ric Flair, Ron Howard, Goodie Mob, and Dikembe Mutombo participated in the Golden Spike tradition in 2019.
Atlanta United FC's principal owner is Arthur Blank, who is also the co-founder of Home Depot.
Since 2022, the president and CEO of Atlanta United FC has been Garth Lagerwey.
Atlanta United FC reserved the number 17 for the fans to mark the team's inaugural season in MLS in 2017.
Following the death of Hank Aaron, Atlanta United FC reserved the number 44 for the 2021 MLS season as a tribute.
Rights to Atlanta United FC first team matches not broadcast by MLS's national television partners were originally held by Bally Sports.
Rights to every MLS game became exclusive to MLS Season Pass on Apple TV+ in 2023.
Kevin Egan was the team's local television play-by-play announcer from 2017 to 2022.
Radio rights for Atlanta United FC have been held by WZGC/92.9 The Game since 2017.
Rights to Atlanta United 2 matches were held by ESPN as part of the USL's broadcast agreement until ATL UTD 2 joined MLS Next Pro in 2023.
Darren Eales served as president of Atlanta United FC from September 10, 2014, to August 24, 2022.
Atlanta United FC won the MLS Cup in 2018.
Atlanta United FC won the U.S. Open Cup in 2019.
Atlanta United FC won the MLS Eastern Conference Championship in 2018.
Atlanta United FC won the Campeones Cup in 2019.
The top goalscorer(s) in MLS includes goals scored in which of the following competitions? A) League matches only, B) MLS Cup Playoffs, C) U.S. Open Cup, D) All of the above
The average attendance statistics for MLS are based on which type of matches? A) League matches only, B) U.S. Open Cup, C) MLS Cup Playoffs, D) FIFA Club World Cup
Atlanta United set the MLS Cup attendance record on December 9, 2018.
Atlanta was awarded an MLS expansion team for 2017 on April 16, 2014.
Falcons owner Arthur Blank withdrew his bid for an MLS soccer team on January 16, 2009, but later succeeded in securing an expansion team for Atlanta.
Atlanta United played its first MLS match on March 5, 2017, against New York Red Bulls.
Atlanta United's Josef Martínez won the 2018 Landon Donovan MLS MVP award.
Atlanta United won the MLS Cup in 2018.
LA Galaxy won the MLS Cup in 2024.
The Miami Fusion was an MLS team from 1998 to 2001.
Chivas USA was an MLS team from 2005 to 2014.
The MLS Cup was not held in the years 2000 and 2001.
The Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup three times in 2008, 2020, and 2023.
Atlanta United FC won their first MLS Cup in 2018.
Toronto FC reached the MLS Cup finals in 2016, 2017, and 2019, winning in 2017.
Atlanta United FC's kit sponsor from 2025–present is Emory Healthcare.
Atlanta United FC has played at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Georgia from 2017 to the present.
Brad Guzan, the captain of Atlanta United FC, plays as a goalkeeper and is from the USA.
Miguel Almirón, who played as a forward for Atlanta United FC, is from Paraguay.
Ronny Deila, from Norway, is the head coach of Atlanta United FC.
Arthur Blank, from the United States, is the owner and chairman of the Blank Family of businesses, which includes Atlanta United FC.
Gerardo "Tata" Martino served as the coach of Atlanta United FC from September 27, 2016, to December 10, 2018.
Gonzalo Pineda is listed as the coach of Atlanta United FC from August 12, 2021, to June 3, 2024.
Josef Martínez scored the highest number of goals in a single season for his team in 2018 with 35 goals.
In 2019, the team won both the Campeones Cup and the U.S. Open Cup (USOC).
The team's highest average attendance was in 2018, with 53,002 spectators.
Brad Guzan has the most total appearances for the team with 234 across all competitions.
Josef Martínez is the top goalscorer for the team with 111 goals in all competitions.
The team was eliminated in the quarterfinals of the CONCACAF Champions League in 2019 and 2021 by Monterrey and Philadelphia Union, respectively, with an aggregate score of 1-3 in both instances.
In the 2020 MLS season, the team finished 12th in the conference and 23rd overall, their lowest league finish recorded here.
Thiago Almada scored 26 goals for the team in all competitions, making him the second-highest scorer behind Josef Martínez.
The team's participation in the Leagues Cup in 2023 saw them being eliminated in the group stage with a penalty shootout loss to Cruz Azul (4-5 p).
Josef Martínez won the top goalscorer title for his team in multiple seasons, specifically in 2018, 2019, 2021, and 2022.
